description: Extension to existing basement including front and rear lightwells
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:11pt">Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</span></span></p><p><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:11pt"><br></span></span></p><p><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="font-size:11pt">REASON: In the interests of ensuring suitable provision of sustainable drainage onsite.<br></span></span><br></p>

<p>Prior to the commencement of works, details of the landscaping to the retain rear garden area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The retained area should comprise of soft landscaping.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: In the interests of enhancing biodiversity.</p>

<p>All new materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.

</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure the development integrates with the host building and surrounding streetscene.</p>
